🍷#CaliforniaWineFridays Indulgence begins in the vineyard for @diorawines
.
🙌Keeping the Monterey theme going this Friday with the Diora La Splendeur du Soleil Chardonnay!
.
🍇Monterey is a cool-climate region through and through, BUT it is also home to a vibrant array of micro-climates that express different facets of the region
.
🤓Just a short drive inland are the rolling hills of the Santa Lucia Mountain Range. Aptly named, Santa Lucia is the saint of light. The highland vineyards of the region get some heavy sunlight throughout the growing season. With a cool and steady climate, grapes grow to craft wines filled with sunshine. As a result, the wines are bold, with nerve and intensity.
.
🍷The La Splendeur du Soleil Chardonnay is an expression of this unique micro-climate. Made from grapes grown on the estate’s San Bernabe Vineyard, the vineyard is harvested block by block. Going straight to the barrel, this is a 100% barrel-fermented wine done in 45% new oak which makes for an elegant, well-balanced Chardonnay.
👃Taking in the aromas of this wine, you will find notes of golden apples, tropical tones, fresh apricots, and Meyer lemon, intermingled with toasted notes and hints of cream brûlée and pear.
👅On the palate, the wine is layered with flavours that keep going. There are fruit notes of white peach and key lime dispersed throughout for a fresh and lively finish
.
🥂A Chardonnay that is showing off the sunshine of Monterey. Find this wine at the @LCBO This is a truly expressive wine perfect to be paired with summer dishes
.
💁🏻‍♀️When is the last time you enjoyed a bottle of Monterey Chardonnay?
.

🍷#WinePairingMonday - 🤩Pairing it up with some non-acl Pinot Noir by @leitzzero wines
.
🤔Have you been diving into the world of nonalcoholic wines yet? 
🙌If you have, I am sure you have noticed there is a lot out there to try. Nearly a decade ago, this wine category started taking off, and today there are some stellar wines to try that are just as pairable and enjoyable as full-strength options. Leitz is one of them!
.
🍷Today I am pairing up the Leitz Pinot Noir with a beautiful smoked Quail from the Vineland Estates Restaurant menu
.
🥂Let’s get into the wine first.
🤔Leitz crafts these wines from vineyard to bottle. With the fermentation done using a vacuum distillation process, which is efficient and takes just a moment to de-alcoholize the wine. All while keeping the aromas and flavours that you would expect from the wine style. 
🥰This Germany Pinot Noir is filled with aromas of mushroom, cherry, floral and twiggy aromas. Take a sip, and you are greeted with a classically styled wine that has great structure and brightness, plus just a touch of tannins
.
🍷Pinot is a lovely pairing with quail. Matching the Leitz Pinot Noir to the Smoked Quail dish shows the delicacy of both. There is a lightness and ease to the pairing that elevates the dish and the wine at the same time, without the heady feeling of drinking of full strength wine
.
😉Non-alc wines offer options when pairing. Leitz is great for not skimping on flavour, providing what you would expect from a great pairing without the hit in the best ways possible
.
🥂If you are in for adding some more inclusive wines to your cellar, Leitz Wines and fit for the job!
👉Hit up @vinelandestates to add this wine to your cellar
.
💁🏻‍♀️Have you tried this non-alc Pinot Noir yet?
.
[Sponsored Partnership with Vineland Estate Winery and Leitz Wine]

🍷Taking off early with a bottle of @bodegaspiqueras Castillo de Almansa Old Vines!
.
🥳It is 5 o’clock somewhere, and I am reliving my last week in Spain’s La Mancha region with a wine that has a deep connection to that sense of place. Yes, last week, I was in Spain sipping on wines from across the country, and the deep culture struck me in the glass of La Mancha wines
.
🏰Castillo De Almansa has a rich history in the region. You will find the DO Almansa and the winery on the far eastern reaches of La Mancha. Named after the Castle of Almansa, a Moorish fortress, the castle has watched over the city of Almansa since the 13th century. Protecting the town’s past, present and future and has become the iconic symbol of a range of Bodegas Piqueras wines since 1972
.
🍇The Castillo de Almansa 2017 Selección red is crafted from old vines of Monastrell, Garnacha Tintorera, Tempranillo and Syrah, all aged for 14 months in French oak barrels. The combination of winemaking a terroir comes together to make a wine that has stopped me in my tracks and has forced me away from the desk and out into the light
.
🍷There is a great elegance to this wine with a harmony of dark fruit and spice notes, followed by a palate that is elegant, expressive and with a silky finish. I will pair this wine with some elevated tacos for dinner, but for now, this is a soul-southing sipper!
.
👉Find the Castillo de Almansa 2017 Selección at the @LCBO now
.

🍹Super Caesars! Today on @cityline with @thetracymoore
.
🙌Extra, extra, hear all about it! Tomorrow is Caesar Day Canada, and today, I am serving up a couple of different takes on the classic Caesar
👉Follow my Link in Bio to catch the full DL on these takes on this Classic Canadian Cocktail
.
😉Give these new takes a try!
.
🍹The Beer Caesar or Michelada done with @drinklibra Non-Alc Pale Ale
✨Start with a rocks glass, and feel free to rim it with Tajin and Chili Flakes if you like it spicy
✨Add ice to the glass, then fill the glass with:
✨2 oz lime juice 
✨4 dashes Worcestershire Sauce 
✨4 dashes Soy Sauce 
✨4 dashes Tabasco Sauce
✨3oz of a 50/50 mix of Tomato Juice and Clamato Juice 
✨Then fill the glass to the top with Libra Pale Ale
.
🍹The Green Caesar with @magnottawinery 271 Single Malt Whiskey
✨Start with a tall glass rimmed with Tajin and Salt
✨Fill the glass with ice, then add:
✨2oz of Magnotta's 271 Whiskey 
✨2 dashes of Worcestershire Sauce 
✨2 dashes of Tobasco Sauce 
✨Top up the glass with a green Caesar mix
(The Green Caesar base is made by blending together 3 tomatillos, ½ TSP of salt, 1oz Lime Juice, 1 quarter cucumber, 1 quarter of an avocado, ¼ cup of cilantro leaves, ½ TSP Old Bay Seasoning. Let sit, then double strain for a particle-free mixture)
✨Serve with a lemongrass stick of celery stock, lime and coriander for garnish
.
🍹Finally, a very elegant Clear Caesar with @renpremiumvodka
✨In a cocktail shaker add ice and:
✨2oz of Ren Vodka 
✨3oz of Tomato Water
(The Clear Caesar Tomato water is made from 15 tomatoes,1/3 stalk of lemon grass, 2 celery stalks,2 oz olive juice, 2oz pickle juice, 1 anchovy, juice of half a lime, 1 zested lime, juice of half a lemon, 1 lemon zested, 6 dashes of Tabasco, 1 half of green chilli pepper, 1 clove of garlic, 1 tsp salt, and a handful of chopped parsley. Blend and strain through a cheesecloth for days and keep clear remains for the cocktail)
✨Shake it all up in your cocktail shaker 
✨Double strain and serve in fancy @juliannaglassware
.

.
🍇Cross over the eastern hills of Napa Valley, and you will be in the Solano County AVA of Suisun Valley. Often described as up-and-coming, the Suisun Valley recently celebrated 40 years o winemaking
.
🤓However, the wine region has a much longer history than that. The valley took up its winemaking roots back in the 1800s. A side effect of Phylloxera, then Prohibition and WW2, the Suisun Valley’s former prominence is only now returning to the limelight. And with a Wagner Family winery opening its doors in the region, we are sure to see more from the Suisun Valley coming soon
.
🥂50 years after founding Caymus, the winery has taken on a new project, the Caymus-Suisun Winery. The warm days and cool nights, paired with the San Pablo Bays’ maritime influence, brought the vintners to the region. With its richer soils, the valley offers a new playing ground for the Caymus style of winemaking which is ominated by the grapes of Petite Syrah, Zinfandel and Sauvignon Blanc
.
🍇The Walking Fool wine is a production born from the winery’s excitement for the Suisun Valley and honours a long passed family history in the region to the Wagner family. Spending the last ten years exploring the region’s reaches on the other side of Napa’s hills, t the Wagner family was drawn to craft a wine that represents this story
.
🍷A blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah, this wine brings bold red fruit and dark berry notes alongside notes of espresso and mocha. This is a rich and voluptuous wine, characterized with a bold expression on the palate yet revealing soft and velvet like tannins
.
👉Find this bottle at the @LCBO and explore what the Suisun Valley can do!
.
💁🏻‍♀️Are you in for a glass?
.

😉How do you, Passito?
.
🤓Passito wines are a dried grape production from Italy that are sweet dessert wines made from dried grapes. The name passito comes from the longer format “appassimento’ which means withering in Italian. However, this style of winemaking has been exported around the world!
.
🤩@magnottawinery here in Ontario makes a Passito-style wine using Vidal grapes. Done air-dried and only from hand-selected vineyard offerings, this is a wine that brings the Italian roots of Magnotta’s owners into the mix 
.
🍷On its own, the Magnotta Vidal Passito is a fragrant wine with notes of melon, peach, white flowers, dried green fig, and touches of apricots. On the palate, it is sweet but complemented by a bright acidity which gives this wine great structure. 
😉This wine is the perfect meal-ender for dessert or to be sipped alone
.
🍹Although, there is more that you can do with this Passito.
🤓Have you had a Passito Cocktail before?
🤩Super easy to make, in an iced glass, add one ounce of lychee juice, two ounces of the Magnotta Vidal Passito and then top with sparkling water.
Garnish this low -ABV cocktail with some canned/pitted lychees; you are ready to go. 
☀️This refreshing summer cocktail shows off a bit of sweetness but is an excellent comment on a hot day!
.
🥂There are many ways to enjoy Passito 
👉Find the Magnnota Vidal Canadian Passito through their winery stores, or order direct to your door and give both versions a try for yourself!
.
💁🏻‍♀️So which are you in for?
.
[Sponsored Partnership with Magnotta Winery]

🍇Happy Chardonnay Day! - 🍷Celebrating one of the world’s most versatile grapes with wines by @desimonevineyards and @cloudsleycellars
.
🤩Chardonnay is one of the most popular and versatile grapes in the world!
🤓A shapeshifter of winemaking styles, there are countless ways that Chardonnay, the grape, can be turned into Chardonnay, the wine. From fresh and lifted stainless-steel winemaking styles to oak-aged or even made as an Orange Wine and Sparkling. Lees ages, cellar aged, done in concrete, and various barrel styles Chardonnay will always be Chardonnay, but this grape has a unique way of communicating wine style that is unmatched by other grape varieties. And in my mind, it is what makes Chardonnay so special
.
🥂Ontario makes some amazing cool climate Chardonnay!
.
🍷The De Simone Vineyards Chardonnay is a 2019 barrel fermented and aged production. This wine shows a more opulent side of Chardonnay in this glass with rich fruit and toasted notes. On the palate, it is bright and leads toward that cooler-climate style of structure Ontario Chardonnays can show in the glass
.
🍷The Cloudsley Cellars 2020 Twenty Mile Bench Chardonnay is a vineyard selected Chardonnay that shows off  both the well-known Fowcoft and Wingfield Vineyards. This is a wine with a  much fresher style in the glass. There are aromas of spices and nuttiness, showing oak treatment, but there is bright fruits and on the palate a structure that leads with acidity and minerality
.
🤩Both these wines show how much variation one grape can communicate, even made in the same space. Nothing like Chardonnay to communicate a level of terroir that goes from vineyard to winemaker before you take a sip!
.
🥂Cheers to Chardonnay Day!
💁🏻‍♀️What Chardos are you sipping on today?

🍷Cheers to #CaliforniaWineFridays - 😉Ending off this excursion off on a bold note with the @joshcellars Reserve Paso Robles Cab Sauv
.
🍇Cabernet Sauvignons from Paso Robles are richer and bolder than the wines you might find in Napa. They are known for their berry flavours, peppercorn spice, and gravel mineral notes. If you are into robust reds, Paso is the place for you!
.
🤓Tucked between Los Angeles and San Francisco in the rugged area of the Central Coast, the area was co-founded by outlaws Frank and Jesse James’ uncle, Drury James, in the mid-19th century. Today, this region is lovingly referred to as the land of cowboys and wine. A wine region that plays by its own rules in an entrepreneurial and very innovative way
.
🥂Josh Cellars is a winery that follows these same sentiments. It started by Joseph “Josh” Carr whose winemaking journey began in New York State, where his love of wine was discovered. But it was not until many decades later that he realized he wanted wine to be at the epicentre of life.
.
🤩Launching his first winemaking endeavours in the early 2000s, everything snowballed for Carr. Many wines and vineyard explorations later, Josh Cellars unveiled the first vintages of its Reserve line in 2016. Their goal was to craft wines that showed the fruits of premium vineyards in California’s North Coast and Paso Robles regions
.
🍷The Josh Cellars Reserve Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon is filled with aromas of rich, red fruit notes with powerful scents of black peppercorn. Complemented by a fruit-driven palate with toasted qualities, plush tannins and a smooth finish. A perfect embodiment of Paso Robles!
.
👉Find this big and bold wine at the @LCBO
.

.

.

.

🙌#ThrowbackSaturday - 🥂To sipping on some epic Irish Gin by @glendaloughdistillery in Ireland, of course
.
🍾A couple of months ago, I got the chance to have an amazing experience in Ireland. This Gin should be vintage-dated, in my opinion. The Glendalough Wild Botanical Gin takes a year to make and is crafted from foraged herbs and botanicals around the area of Glendalough
.
☘️The valley with two lakes, Glendalough, is a natural wonder nestled in the Wicklow Mountains just south of Dublin. This was the home of a monastic settlement founded by St. Kevin, who found divine inspiration in the wilds of nature. This is the inspiration behind the gin in the bottle
.
🤓Full-time forager Geraldine Kavanagh grew up in the Count of Wicklow. This beautiful mountain countryside is where she spends the year foraging for all the botanicals that make this gin what it is. Every month of the year is different and brings in a new batch of botanicals that are distilled and blended together. The botanicals are infused in neutral spirit overnight before distillation the following day. Master distiller Rowdy Rooney heads up the blending in the distillery.
.
🤩The final result is a wild botanical gin with juniper, lemon, and pine note, and a light, fresh meadow note. The palate reveals honeysuckle, spice, and citrus flavours, along with a delicate floral tone. It’s medium-bodied and fruity with a long, balanced finish. When I tell you I rarely enjoy a gin martini to the fullest until I tried this version of gin in a cocktail, I was blown away by the level of complexity and harmony with every sip
.
🌹Coming in a rose style as well, made with distilled roses from Rowdy’s mother’s garden. A tribute to his late mother with notes of citrus, rose petals, orange zest, anise, and spice notes. It was a treat to see the wild expressed in the glass in such a touching way
.
👉You can find both the Rose and the Wild Botanical Gin at the @LCBO right now 
🥂These gins are a delight!
.
💁🏻‍♀️Have you tried a gin like this before?

.
🙌Celebrated, beloved and inspiring, Napa Valley is undoubtedly America's most famous wine region!
.
👉Follow my Link in Bio to dive into an exploration of Napa, all told with a touch of history and through the lens of 8 wineries
.
😉Here is just a peek:
A tiny piece of winemaking heaven, Napa is a rare find in many ways, crafting wines that fill cellars with some of the highest-priced wines in the game. It is almost hard to believe that you could once get a bottle of Napa Valley wine for the staggering price of $6 per bottle. And while that was the cost of Napa's finest during the Judgement of Paris, the region, the wines and the wine lovers who drink Napa through and through have changed a lot since that moment. Napa has a jewel-like history that is ever-evolving. At the moment, Napa has a youthful glow, but its history will keep you on the edge of your seat. This small section of vineyards, only a sixth of the size of Bordeaux, with its many dips, peaks, valleys, and vast range of expressions of terroir, tells a story. One told through the wines and the wineries at the heart of the Napa-mission. If Napa is worth the space in your cellar, the short answer is yes, but I'll get into all that

It’s a #PinotGrigoDay over here!
.
While wine snobs often love to hate Pinot Grigio, I am not here to rag on a grape that produces yummy wine. The fact is that there is a lot of Pinot Grigio out there, and from the right region, the right terroir expression, Pinot Grigo can be compelling, fun and incredibly enjoyable!
.
The northeast of Italy is the heartland of Pinot Grigio. It would be best to look for bottles from Veneto, Friuli-Venezia Giulia and Trentino-Alto Adige. Hailing from Trentino in the glass today is the @cantina_lavis Pinot Grigio Trentino DOC
.
Making wine from local grapes in the game for this cantina, and they do a stellar job translating Pinot Grigio’s grape into the glass. Going with the bright and lifted nature of the grape, the Lavis Pinot Grigio is expressive and easy-going with charisma in the glass, showing notes of ripe yellow fruits, honey and minerality. This wine stands out on the palate with an easy-drinking vibe to match
.
Plus, there is the bonus that this wine is also vegan and sustainably made. All the more reason to enjoy the bottle without any guilt. And it is a steal of a deal for the price.
.
Find the Cantina Lavis Pinot Grigio from the Trentino DOC at the @LCBO now
.
Are you in the mood for a glass of Pinot Grigio?
.

🍇A famous grape demands a good photoshoot📸
.
🍷All jokes aside, today I am sipping on @poderidalnespoli1929 Famoso Rubicone IGT. A Bianco or white wine from the Italian region of Emilia-Romagna
.
🤓A wine crafted from the Uva Rambela, AKA Famoso. An indigenous grape from the region rediscovered in the last ten years; this wine tells a story. A translation from Famoso in Italian as the grape is known for its strong nose. And boy, does this wine have an incredibly fragrant aroma!
.
🍷From the moment you pop this bottle and pour yourself a glass, you are greeted with aromas of yellow flowers, orange blossoms and jasmine, tropical and white fruits. Complement on the palate by an intense and rich body with a bright finish
.
🤩It is a great wine to be paired with seafood dishes, risotto and white meats done with fresh herbs. Plus, I love when a winery brings a grape back to life. It gives all of us a chance to explore a different grape like we would not have seen in ages
.

🙌Provence - 🍷Made For Going All-In On Rosé!
.
🥂Provence is a megastar for all things pink wine. This southern French wine region is the number one wine region for Rosé in the country, making up just over 4% of all Rosé wine in the world. A combination of great terroir and centuries of winemaking has made the region the top place for Rosé.
.
🤓Nestled between the Mediterranean Sea and the Alps, Provence benefits from a unique terroir that contributes to the distinctive characteristics of its wines, which has extended from the time of the Ancient Greeks to the present day. Rosé is the oldest known winemaking practice in the world, making Provence one of the oldest wine regions in France.
.
😉Explore the depth of Provence Rosé wines through the major wine regions of Coteaux d’Aix-en-Provence, Coteaux Varois en Provence, and Côtes de Provence. Each region offers a unique perspective on the Provance sense of place in the glass.
.
👉So if you are in the mood for Rosé, find these delicious Provence Rosé wines at the @LCBO now!
🍷@chateaudesferrages Plaisir Sainte-Victoire Rosé 2021 from the  Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire subregion
🍷@hechtbannier Coteaux d’Aix en Provence Rosé 2021 from Coteaux d’Aix-en-Provence
🍷And @estandoncooperativeenprovence Terres de Saint-Louis Coteaux-Varois-en-Provence Rosé 2021 from the AOC of Coteaux Varois en Provence
.

🍇Primitivo is the grape to watch and @barbanera_wine Duca di Saragnano Alchymia Primitivo 2020 is a delicous renditon
.
🤓You might have tried different expressions of this grape in the past. Part of the Zinfandel/Tribidrag/Primitivo family, all of these grapes come from the same origin, and they all have the same DNA, but the expressions of each are a workshop in terroir in the glass. When it comes to diving into what makes Primitivo, Primitivo is its freshness, minerality, dark fruit notes and a unique ability to pair so well with foods!
.
🍷So today, I am going all in on this grapes food pairing skills with the Duca di Saragnano Alchymia Primitivo with my ultimate favourite food, pizza. 
.
😉Part of a line of wines by Barbanera, The Duca di Saragnano line still celebrates the bond of deep friendship between Luigi Barbanera and one of the last heirs of the title “Duke of Saragnano”. A wine with a story behind the bottle and made with a grape that is having a moment that is well deserved, Primitivo
.
🍷Diving into the glass, this boldly coloured deep-rudy-toned wine is filled with jammy black fruit and berry notes in the glass. Cherries, blackberries, black currants, earthy tones and great mineral expression. Followed by a palate that is smooth, with velvety tannins but not overbaring. It is a perfect wine to pair with a simple meal like this and take it to the ultimate next level 
.
🍇Enter into the world of Primitivo, there is so much you could pair with this Italian red. The possibilities are for you to explore

🍇🇫🇷The Grapes of Provence!🇫🇷🍇
.
🙌Provence’s three major wine regions, Côtes de Provence, Coteaux d’Aix en Provence, and Coteaux Varois en Provence, each have their own distinct terroir and grape varieties, resulting in a diverse and exciting array of wines to be enjoyed
.
🍷Whether it’s the lush fruitiness of Grenache, the vibrant acidity of Cinsault, and the depth and structure of Syrah, the grapes of Provence contribute to wines that are celebrated for their elegance, balance, and vibrancy. And blending together, these grapes make Provence wines so pairable and enjoyable with many meals or to be had on their own
.
😉Each grape adds a little something-something to the final wine!
🍇With all the grapes of Provence bringing a unique perspective of the region to the glass, you can taste the complexity of each region in every sip
.
🍷The @la_sangliere_wine the La Riviera Rosé 2021, from Côtes de Provence, shows off notes of cherry, red berry notes, nectarine, fresh floral notes and soft spices, followed by a palate that is mineral-driven, fresh and crisp. 
🍇All coming from a blend of Grenache and Cinsault
.
🍷In the Coteaux Varois en Provence, the @estandoncooperativeenprovence Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé 2021 brings to the glass notes of melon, citrus, strawberry, raspberry, watermelon, grapefruit, lavender and soft herbal and pepper notes. The wine is zesty and fresh on the palate, with a bright finish and bold structure. 
🍇Communicating a blend of Cinsault, Grenache, and Syrah
.
🍷And the @maisonmirabeau the X Rosé Mirabeau 2021, from Coteaux d’Aix en Provence, has aromas of lemon, grapefruit, red berry fruit notes, touches of pepper spice and juicy freshness. Complemented by a palate that is well-structured, crisp, inviting and long-lived.
🍇Bringing to life a blend of  Grenache, Syrah, and Cinsault grapes
.
🤩Explore the art of living a rosé-y life.

.

📖Hot off the presses the latest edition of The Wine Effect in @ddmtoronto - 🍷A Retrospective in Riesling by Flat Rock Cellars 
.
🍇While it might have been a secret to the rest of the world, here in Ontario, there has been the long-held belief that the Niagara Peninsula has the perfect growing conditions for making world-class Riesling. With 20 years of Riesling in view, @flatrockcellars has been confident about Riesling in Ontario since the winery began. 
.
👉Follow my Link in Bio to read on and dive into the point of view of Flat Rock Cellars through Riesling over 20 years of wines from the Nadja's Vineyard.
.
😉Here is a sneak peek:
This vintage, 2023, marks the 20th anniversary of the Nadja's Vineyard Riesling. A vineyard that has always been seen as unique and special by Ed Madronich, owner and son of the founder of Flat Rock Ed Sr. So loved that the site was named Nadja's Vineyard after Ed's mother. However, it is not just this sentimental value that makes this vineyard worth drinking. The Nadja's Vineyard makes some stellar wine in the glass, scoring between 90 to 97 points at wine competitions since 2004. Even winning the prestigious Best in Show and Top 50 Wines Awards at the Decanter World Wine Awards. A genuinely fantastic win for the winery and Canadian winemaking as a whole. So with all that said, and this being the month of Canada Day, it is time to dive into the world of Ontario Riesling through the last 20 years of Nadja's Vineyard wines in the glass. 

Riesling, the grape, loves to grow in cool regions. These grapes also love a slope. All mixed with the clay-loam soils, make for a wine with great structure on the palate. This is precisely what you get in the glass with the Rieslings of Nadja's Vineyard. 
.
🥂Read on for all the notes on the 20 Rieslings tasted!
.

🥃Summer is made for Rum!
.
🤩From tiki bars to poolside sipping, even just sitting on the patio and soaking in the sunshine, rum drinks abound during summer. BUT not all rums are created equal 
.
🤓Crafted on the banks of Demerara in Guyana @eldoradorums are uniquely smooth-aged rums that have been repping the region for over 300 years. Making this Caribbean run is all about patience, but the rum is worth the wait. The whole ecosystem of Demerara goes hand in hand. From the cane sugar that makes the molasses for rum crafting to the climate and cask ageing, creating the right environment for fabulous rums to mature. As I said, it is all about patience
.
🥂Today I am mixing up some cocktails and sipping on:
The El Dorado 5 Year, 8 Year and 12 Year Rums
.
🍹For a quick summer cocktail, give a try to a Rum and Tonic 
This cocktail is simple to make using a 1 to 2 ratio of 5-Year-Old El Dorado Rum to Tonic Water. Just serve over ice with lime wheels 
Sweeter than a G&T, the Rum and Tonic is an easy day sipper that can complement snack and sunshine 
.
🍹If you are in for a richer, more spirit-forward cocktail, now is the time for a Rum Old Fashion done with the 8-Year-Old El Dorado Rum 
Made in a cocktail glass, add in 2oz of Rum with bitters and a sugar cube, and string over ice 60 times for the perfect combination. The serve with an orange twist 
This is a cocktail that puts rum in the forefront and has a way of letting you relax back and enjoy the day 
.
🍹Finally, you can get into all the aromas and flavours of Demerara with the El Dorado 12-Year-Old 
No need for a cocktail with this one. Serve as-is in a brandy-style glass, like mine from @juliannaglassware
To get into all the aromas of tropical, spice and sweet notes, followed by a palate that is complex and sapid
.
👉El Dorado Rums can be found on @LCBO shelves now!
You can taste through the beauty of the El Dorado world with aged Rums from 5 to 25 years old 
.
💁🏻‍♀️Are you getting into Rum this summer?
.

🖼️🍷A story of art and wine with @magnottawinery 2016 Limited Edition Merlot🍷🖼️
.
🎨Wine is the art of translating the vineyard. Translating agriculture and farming into a new medium that can be experienced and enjoyed on a higher level. A level that adds emotion, care and intention. Years and years ago, when I was growing up, I so badly wanted to be an artist. I would look at museum-worthy works and hope to myself that my doings would one day be museum-worthy. Time always has different plans for us than we envision when younger, but the passion and meaning of art is something that has always stuck with me. And it is these same feelings that I have about wine in my life today 
.
🍇Supporters of community building, the family-run winery has always had a passion for art. The winery owns more than 400 pieces of original artwork that can be found displayed in Magnotta stores and on their bottles, including their Limited Edition line. Showcasing artists like A.Y. Jackson and Arthur Lismer from the Group of Seven, Lena Shugar, Olivia Brouwer, and even artists closer to home like Alessia Magnotta
.
🤓Her work can be found on the front label of the 2016 Merlot Limited Edition VQA. Magnotta is a family winery, and this work is a love letter expressing those family ties. Magnotta has built their extensive wine collection expressing the unique osmatic relationship between art and wine. This piece adorning the front of the bottle is titled, “II muro dell’amore”. A painting inspired by the house of Juliet in Verona, Italy, famous for bold statements of love.
.
🍷Merlot is the grape that brings this painting to life in wine form. This Merlot is an amorous wine with plush aromas of plum and dark fruits, smoke, and sweet spice aromas, coupled with a palate that is Bordeaux-like in style. For me it is a wine I could sip and explore, window side.
.
👉Find this bottle available directly from Magnotta
.
💁🏻‍♀️Are you a lover of the art of wine?
.
[Sponsored Partnership with Magnotta]

🍷#ThrowBackThursday - There is no greater fun than touring a great winery with a fellow wine lover!
.
🤩Back in February, I was in California with the amazing @mimibeatz Christina Rodehau, Founder of @monarch.wine and we took our wine-loving tour on the road. Exploring Napa to the fullest. And while I have put together my thoughts in some articles I am still reliving the very best moments of the trip
.
🍇This was the day we found ourselves at @sullivan.rutherford.estate tasting through an array of wines, all centred around Bordeaux grapes but the star of the show was Cabernet Sauvignon
.
🍷All the wines we explored had that classic Rutherford, Napa, vibe. They were big and plummy with fruit-driving notes and a dusty feel that rang true to the region. Tasting The J.O Sullivan Reserve line with vintages 2016 and 2018 for Cab and the 2014 Reserve line Merlot. this was a heart-stealing wine for me
.
🤓The visionary behind the brand, James O’Neil Sullivan knew Napa’s power and greatness. Aided by the legendary Napa winemaker, Andre Tchelistcheff Sullivan purchased a plot of land that straddles the plateau above neighbouring vineyards. Here the vineyard terroir is streaked with gravel and punctuated by rocky soils. It is also home to the Rutherford Dust, a mineral-rich earth formed millions of years ago, a term coined by Tchelistcheff. Once he saw that Sullivan was in for a winery, Tchelistcheff knew that Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot would be the grapes to plant. The wines represent a past with so much history but a forward notion in the glass that communicates so much potential!
.
💁🏻‍♀️When are you heading out to Napa next?

🥂@fazibattagliawines you make one iconic bottle of Verdicchio!
.
🍇Verdicchio, a grape I am sure you have heard more about lately, is a class for the Italian white wines of Marche. Known for making fresh wines with a deceiving complete struct Verdicchio is at its best when it’s from hills between Jesi and Matelica.
.
🤩Castelli di Jesi Verdicchios are stellar. The region has that perfect mix of climate, soil and energy to fashion the grape into a noteworthy and recognizable wine. And one of the most recognizable producers of Verdeicchio is, without question, Fazi Battaglia
.
🤓A winery started in 1949 by two families (the Fazi’s and Battaglia’s) that was then passed off to the pharmaceutical magnate Francesco Angelini a few years after its creation has grown into an iconic producer in the region. Right from the takeover by Angelini, introducing the winery’s iconic amphora bottle made its day beau. 
🍾The curvy bottle is an eye-catcher but for more than just its looks
.
🍇The Fazi Battaglia Titulus Verdicchio is made from only hand-picked grapes from the hillsides of Castelli di Jesi. The estate fruit is then fermented into wine and spends four months on lees before being bottled and ready to enjoy.
.
🍷Resulting in a wine that delivers fresh white flower, apple, pear and citrus fruit notes on the nose. Followed by a vibrant and mineral-leading plate that brings to straight to Italy with every sip
.
🥂This is a wine ideal for pairing with summer fish dishes, light meats and nibbles in the sunshine
.
💁🏻‍♀️Are you in for a quick trip to Italy?
.

🍷#ThrowBackThursday - To an amazing visit at @opusonewinery
.
🙌Wine people always find other wine people. No matter where I am in the world, if I know a winemaker, I will do my very best to visit. Back in February, I got the chance to spend a bit of time with the genuinely epic @opus_one_winemaker Michael Silacci. He has been the winemaker at the winery since 2001, and there is so much going on to take in.
.
🍷Opus One is really at the apex of technology and great winemaking. The winery has so many resources on hand to play with and develop new ways of making their wine better. We spoke about how they are doing vineyard replanting to maximize the vineyard in a more ecological and social-economical way.  Michael and his team are also working on creating their own yeasts in a block-by-block formation. We also dove into the larger social structure of the company, I would work at Opus One after listening in. On top of all of that, I even got the chance to sit in on a @tonnellerie_taransaud barrel tasting
.
🤓It is always memorable to see every wish a winemaker would have realized. There are rare winemaking moments like this in the world. Opus One is a winery that is unencumbered and with that comes the ability to make wine with a similar sense and great values attached. The 2023 vision is all about people, climate, and wine equality
.
🥂After tasting a delicious and magnificent 2012 and heading off with a bottle of 2019 to be aged in a cellar we were off. But I can’t wait till the next visit!
@shambhavi2005 and I had a memorable time
.
💁🏻‍♀️Have you been to Opus One?

.
🥂Mere moments ago, I was in Rioja exploring vineyards, tasting wines and getting to know that sense of place. But more importantly, I got to visit a winery I have always enjoyed from the region
.
🍇More off the beaten path Finca La Emperatriz, a unique vineyard, 101 hectares in one piece in the village of Baños de Rioja, at the very edge of the Rioja appellation. The vineyard has a climate influenced by the Atlantic, with poor soils and some great older vines too, all of which are in Rioja Alta
.
🍷The immediate sense you get from the wines of the Bodega is a connection to the earth and that is exactly what you see in the vineyard. Named after Eugenia de Montijo, the name of the winery means the estate of the empress, each wine is crafted in a way that brings you to earth on a velvet pillow. forming a connection that is delightful and long-lasting. Done with wines like EL JARDÍN DE LA EMPERATRIZ Bianco and Tinto and the FINCA LA EMPERATRIZ Bianco and Tinto done with the classic grape of Rioja
.
👉Check out my stories for more about the vineyard
🥰The 2017 FINCA LA EMPERATRIZ Rioja is a classic that just captured my palate, and I can’t till the next time I am in Rioja for the next vintage 
.

🥰Because this morning I when ham on a topic I love, having a Happy Hour at Home!
.
🍷Every good happy hour needs a red and white wine option. 
🤓These are the go-to wines that you can keep stocked by the case. A good Happy Hour at Home wine is delicious, has a great story and is well-priced, so it is easy to keep on hand. Plus, it doesn’t hurt to go for classic grape varietals.
✨My top recommendations:
🍷The Neon Coast Chardonnay by @neoncoastwines and found at the @thewineshops
🍷Ironstone Cabernet 😉Sauvignon by @ironstonevineyards and found at the @LCBO
Both of these are at or around $20!
.
🍹A happy hour is only complete with some cocktails!
Now depending on the style of home bartender you are, you might be up for a more effortless or more technical style of drink
.
✨For a pour-and-sip option, Salvador’s Grapefruit Paloma is a great choice.
🤓Palomas are a favourite cocktail in Mexico. It’s a light, fruity drink with the natural flavours of Ruby Red grapefruits and premium tequila. With Salvador’s, it’s simple – there’s no measuring, mixing, or fuss. Just chill, open and pour over ice to enjoy. And garnish this drink with lime or grapefruit
.
✨But if you want to go full-on home bartender, I must suggest making a delicious vodka punch, Like this Ciroc Honey Melon Coconut Milk Punch made with @ciroc Honey Melon Vodka
🤓Blend 12oz of Ciroc Honey Melon Vodka with 3/4th of a whole-cut honeydew melon. Then add in the juice of 8 limes, 4oz of Honey syrup, orange bitters and a small can of coconut cream.
Then just strain and serve over ice or frozen honeydew melon pieces
.
😉Find both these cocktail options at the @lcbo 
.

🍷#ThrowBackThursday - 😉If you guessed I am keeping those Cali moments going then you would be correct. 🤩Today I am fondly remembering @theoremvineyards
.
☀️It was a beautiful spring day when I was visiting Theorem with the ever-epic @mimibeatz for an off-the-cuff @monarch.wine tour of Napa
.
🤓Theorem Vineyards took its roots in Napa six years after Alpha Omega arrived. Taking its start in 2012, Theorem started with a love of wine and Napa. After visiting Napa for years and being enamoured with this region's wines, Kisha and Jason Itkin became vintners. The vineyard's story is one of hard work and determination, driven by the couple while working with some amazingly acclaimed names in wine
.
🍇When they first found their Diamond Mountain AVA property, it appeared to have gone to the wild. However, having well-known Viticulturalist Josh Clark and the man behind many of Napa's 100-point wines, Winemaker Thomas Rivers Brown, come and survey the vineyard lands, they saw some genuine potential. They salvaged an old vine block, which helped create the flagship wine of the vineyard Voir Dire. And Thomas also brought on board winemaker Kathleen Ward
.
🍷Each bottle tells a story, and when poured by James Cerda, Theorem's VP of Operations, in their mountain view tasting room, you get the complete sense of the winery. This winery is modern, boutique and looks to the next stage of Napa wines
.
💁🏻‍♀️Have you tried the wines of Theorem before?

🍕Pizza and 🍷wine and I'm feeling fine today on @myliquidpleasures with the 🤩Angelo Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
.
🇮🇹This is an Italian red wine made from the Montepulciano grape in the Abruzzo region of east-central Italy not to be confused with Vino Nobile di Montepulciano from Tuscany
.
🤓From the stunning region of Abruzzo, this native grape to the lands comes from some stellar terroir. Abruzzo is flanked by the turquoise Adriatic Sea and the foothills of the Apennine Mountains. This area is lush green, rugged terroir FILLED with Calcareous clay soils, which have high limestone content. These soils are known to produce some of the most bold and muscular wines, which is exactly what you get in the glass! 
.
🍷A dark ruby colour and filled with floral and dark fruit notes, this wine is one that continues its journey on the palate and adds bold spices, olive notes and a grand finish
.
🙌A perfect pizza wine!

🚨New Article Drop 📖 in @ddmtoronto for the latest edition of 🍷The Wine Effect - A View Into The Wines Of Zuccardi
.
👉Follow my #LinkInBio for all the details on this epic Argentinian winery
.
😉Here is a sneak peak:

Named one of the world’s best vineyards, @zuccardivalledeuco is a name to know in Argentinian wine circles. Seriously, this is a winery well-known for its level of excellence. They have received high acclaim from top publications like Wine Enthusiast and won many awards. Even the people behind the winery, the lifeblood of everything Zuccardi, have been recognized for their level of ingenuity added to the wine industry. I am sure you have seen the wines of Zuccardi before on LCBO. And if you have ventured to try the wine of Zuccardi, you know how delicious they are. But this is a winery about more than just wines. 

I remember the first time the name Zuccardi started to stick in my mind. My colleague showed me an image of a Zuccardi vineyard mapped out by the soil type that had laid beneath the vines. She followed up this image with a fantastic story of a harvest, all about how winemaker Sebastián Zuccardi would plot out his vineyard into polygon-style shapes, harvesting by soil type and avoiding the rows and block style of harvest that is commonplace in commercial winemaking. For a large winery such as Zuccardi, I was instantly intrigued.
.
🍇I also get into tasting notes on some wines in the Zuccardi lineup, including:
🍷The Zuccardi Serie A 2022 Torrontés 
🍷The Zuccardi Q 2021 Malbec 
🍷The 2019 Zucardi Q Cabernet Sauvignon 
🍷And the Zuccardi 2020 Concreto Malbec 
.

🍷This week I am sharing my stories from Rioja!
🤩I got the chance to visit this amazing world wine region this summer and I am so excited to share the trip with all of you
.
😉BUT before I do, I want to hear your Rioja stories
📣Tell them to me in the comments below. Have you been to Rioja, have a great Rioja wine story or just something I would never expect
.
💁🏻‍♀️So, what is your Rioja story?

🍷This week of Rioja is starting off with a visit to @marquesderiscal
.
🤩It has been on my list of wineries to visit for some time now. How can you not want to go here, wine over or not Marqués de Riscal is a Spanish destination!
That Frank Gehry building it just a masterpiece
.
🥂Arriving just in time for a cool glass of XR 2022 Rosé and a splash of Fina Montico Verdejo Sobre Lias before heading into a grand tour of the cellar, the wine library, the vineyard  and the works behind the bottle
.
🤩But the cherry on top of this visit was the chance to try an older vintage of house Rioja from 1956
Tasting a back vintage from the 90s and onward is a rare occurrence. And I savour every moment of them. Last year I popped open a bottle of Marqués de Riscal 1987 Rueda. The wine was made mere moments after the wine set up their white wine vineyards in the region and this time around I got the chance to try a back vintage from the region the winery started from
.
🍇Regarded as a good vintage the 1956 had such life and character in the glass!
🍷Filled with aromas of mulled spices and dried herbs, mixed with truly ripe fruit notes of cherry and plum, with touches of dried purple flowers, aged balsamic and leathered earth notes. 
😍On the palate the wine is textural, it sits on the tougne like you would float in a large body of water. The wine had an expansive feelto it and once swalled the palate is greated with a leveled brightness and smooth aurling finish
Such a great experience
.
🙌Spending the day at the winery, eating, drinking, and chatting the night away with friends it was a fabulous and unforgettable visit!
.
💁🏻‍♀️Is this one of your bucket-list wineries to visit?

🍷It is all about that barrel aging. 🙌The next stop in this tour of @rioja is @lariojaaltasa
.
🪵Barrel ageing wine is part of the Rioja way. The region is known for long aging in American oak barrels, and at Bodega La Rioja Alta, they are still doing their barrel racking by candlelight. For a winery that makes its own barrels, this is the next step in the fully in-depth process of their winemaking. As the wines are racked they are looking for sediment. This filters the wine through the aging process
.
🤩It was so cool to see this side of the process. Wine is ultimately an agricultural resource, and seeing particles like this brings it back into perspective
.
💁🏻‍♀️Have you seen this winemaking process before?

🍷@vivancoculturadevino is the next stop on this tour of @rioja
.
🤩From fabulous views and art in the vineyard. A concert in the cellar and a museum that put the history of wine into focus, Vivanco is all about the culture of wine.
.
🍇The wines showcase their viewpoint of Rioja, but the winery overall has a feel that is global and encompassing of the world of wine.
.
🥂From the moment you enter the winery, you are greeted by a window to the world, a very well-said statement through the architecture of this winery. 
.
💁🏻‍♀️Have you visited the world of Vivanco yet?

🍷#HappyFriday y’all! I am on my last stop of the tour @ysiosbodegas for a walking food and wine tour
.
🤩Visiting Ysios was the final stop on a marvellous trip through Rioja for the World’s Best Vineyard Tour. This was a fabulous place to end
.
🍇As you walk up to the winery, Ysios looks like a wave of rocks that burst forth from the earth, then carefully rearranges itself into a format fit for a winery. The building was designed by  Santiago Calatrava with every intention to fit into the landscape.
.
🍷An expression of Rioja Alavesa in the glass the wines of Ysios are lifted and elegant with a vast range of expressions. From ones made with ungrafted vines to unique feats of winemaking and variation of soils in the vineyard 
.

🤓Have you heard of Somm U yet?
.
😉I always get similar questions when I tell people I work in wine. The main one is that my life must be all about drinking and having a good time. And while the good times do come and go, one thing that wine professionals know entirel is that being in wine is more than just about what you taste in the bottle. 
🍷This is a love of wine that is academic in nature and has sparked some of the most interesting discussions I have been a part of, unique and difficult competitions and a camaraderie that is sealed with a good glass of fancy grape juice (...preferably Champagne)
.
🙌This year is a gathering for Canadian Somms/Wine Professionals and anyone up for crossing the board in the name of wine learning. The 2023 Best Sommelier of Canada Competition will be held in Halifax this year by the @caps_ac chapter. The tri-annual event selects the sommelier who will go on to represent Canada in the @asisomms_ competition for the Best Sommelier of the Americas in 2025 and then the World Competition in 2026
.
🤩BUT this year is a special one. Not only is Halifax going to be the site of the competition, it will also be the home of SOMM U (Somm University)!
SOMM U was created to bring the Canadian sommelier community together for mutual learning via Master Classes, tasting exercises and networking events that support unification of the sommelier industry
.
👉Follow my #LinkInBio to check out all the details and the killer events to partake in. Everything is going down in November between November 12th and 16th and yours truly will be there too as on of the Master Class speakers

📚In passenger princess mode today and getting a read in too. Flipping through the pages of @nataliemacleanwine memoir Wine Witch on Fire
.
✨I have always made it a point to support other women in wine. And writing a book is no easy feat. Putting down your life through your eyes into words is even harder to imagine. Natalie’s presence has been in the Toronto wine industry since I started in wine but this book has been an insightful look into her world. Something we all rarely get to experience in the people that we meet, a chance to hear their whole story
.
🙌Today I’ll be getting a moment to connect with her at the Toronto International Festival of Authors and get more the chance to dive in deeper to the story. It’s all in the title, Wine Witch on Fire: Rising from the Ashes of Divorce, Defamation, and Drinking Too Much, and the book itself but I’m excited to her from the woman directly on her thoughts and feelings in this process
.

.

🌱Sustainability with @santamargheritawines in the County 
.
🥂A couple of weeks ago, I got to head out to Prince Edward County for a look into the sustainable world of Santa Margherita wines. One of the big wineries from Italy with a strong belief that they have to do the work. Their wines are a classic, but I am always so happy to see a company put their best foot forward, so to speak, on the sustainablity and climate issues in the world
.
🤓Here are the facts:
🍷Lighter bottles equals less work cardon to ship 
🍷Bottles made from recycled glass are better for the world
🍷Organic farming, done sustainably
🍷Energy reduction
.
🙌And giving back to green landscapes right here in Ontario
🤩All of this is part of the initiatives that Santa Margherita dose
🍾AND their classic Pinot Grigio is fully certified as @carbonzeroca
.
😍I will admit that I do get that warm and fuzzy feeling inside when I see large companies that make recognizable products put their best foot forward to do their part to make environmental change happen.
but the best part about all of this is that you can actually visit some of the places in the Santa Margherita  Carbon Offet Portfolio. 
🌱Including the Niagara Escarpment Forest Carbon Project in Ontario and both the Greenhouse Co-op Biomass Heat Generation Project and Southern Quebec Afforestation Project in Quebec - this is a rarity!
.
😉The next time you are at the @LCBO see about bottle of Santa Margherita wines. enjoy it knowing that this is a wine that gives back
.

😉There is always time for Champagne, especially if it is Vintage Champagne🥂
.
🤓Vintage Champagne is something extraordinary. For a region that is all about blending, bringing together different vineyards, grapes, library wines from different years and winemaking styles, Vintage Champagne is a calm moment that represents just one moment in time. 

🥂In the glass today is the @champagnehenriot Henriot Brut Rosé Champagne 2012, a stellar vintage production crafted from a blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir; this bubbly is known for its toasty brioche notes, raspberry, red pear, melon and textured aromas with delightful mousse on the palate and a complex finish
.
🍇From the house of Champagne Henriot with roots in the early 1800s, this was one of the few women-owned wineries of the time, started by Apolline Henriot in 1808. The history of the house is one that brings together the Côte des Blancs and Montagne de Reims areas of Champagne within every bottle. Now on its 8th generation, the winery is still a family affair, and the passion put into every wine is something that can be tasted with each sip
.
🍾Vintage Champagne is not an every year occurrence; the 2012 vintage was exceptional, the best since the last stellar vintage in 2008. 
👉Find the Henriot Brut Rosé Champagne 2012 on @LCBO shleves now
.
💁🏻‍♀️Are you a fan of Vintage Champagne too?

🍷Heading to the Naramata Bench today with @upperbench
.
🤓The terroir of the Naramata Bench is made up of glacier-formed soils, over 1900+ hours of sunshine, more than 1400 growing degree days and a low level of precipitation ( just over 300mm per year). This is a region that is defining itself in the wine wines that it makes.
.
🍷The Upper Bench Winery and Creamy’s minimalist winemaking style is shown through their Estate Grown Chardonnay. An expressive wine with a natural edge brings out honey, caramel, pistachios, citrus, fruit notes of dried banana, peach and apricot. Crafted in a style that fully integrated barrel aging. Partially oaked, 50% is aged in French oak barrels for 3 months, and 50% is in stainless steel tanks. The limited exposure to oak provides balance and structure without detracting from the fruit and terroir.
.
🍷Riesling is a grape that enjoys the terroir the Naramata Bench offers. In the glass, the Upper Bench Riesling is bright, clean, dry, and crisp, with a lot of versatility on the palate. Filled with notes of tarty apple, citrus and a touch of topicality and a vibrant finish on the palate. 
.
😉Check out my stories for the full tasting notes 
👉Give a visit to @naramatawines for all the details on this unique Canadian wine region
.

🍷🍫Who doesn’t love wine and chocolate? Well, it is the perfect time of year for a candy and wine pairing with the 1925 Baco Noir by @magnottawinery
.
🍷Filled with berry notes, soft herbal tones, and a spice, the Magnotta 1925 Series Baco Noir is smooth on the palate, striking on the light side of medium with an exuberant finish. Making it an ideal wine for some fun chocolate pairing
.
🤓Red wine and chocolate match, but it is not a one-size-fits-all game. This is a wine that does best with milk chocolate. You can play around with the density level on the palate, and add in some caramel and nutty tones too 
.
😉So I went with pairings that encompass some of my favourite Halloween chocolate treats: Twix, Snickers and Maltsters. Each brings out something different in the wine: more fruit, solid tannins and a change in the finish. all of which are a great match
.
🎃Halloween is right around the corner, so if you are in for a candy and wine pairing like I am, hit up Magnotta for a bottle or two of the 1925 Baco Noir. You can find this wine at their Ontario store locations or order right to your door just in time for Halloween night
.

🍷Hey wine lovers, did you catch me on @cityline yesterday talking about all things barrel aging with fellow wine lover @thetracymoore 
.
😉Well..... if you missed me here is your recap. 
👉 And follow my #LinkInBio to rewatch the whole show
🥂Now, let's get into the wine talk.
.
🍇Barrel aging is a unique part of the winemaking process. Not only used in red wines, whites and rosés can be barrel aged as well; the vital thing to note is that barrel aging adds a sense of the winemaker to the final wine. This is the terroir of the winemaker, their voice in the glass. And while barrel aging is done with good barrels, not all winemakers use them similarly. And we get a chance to see that within the wines.
.

🥂INDULGE in my latest feature, "La Fête du ChampagneÈ in @monarch.wine
.
🍾I am so happy about this piece. Rarely, I am not hard on myself after I finish a piece of writing. I honestly always think I could do better. But this was an experience I was instantly able to put into words.
.
👉Follow my #LinkInBio to read the full article and check out Monarch Wine for more coming soon
.
😉But for now, here is a sneak peek:
It has been a long-standing wish of mine to go to La Fête du Champagne. A wine party is not the correct summation of La Fête. This near week-long romp of wine tastings features superstar Champagne Houses and the fabulous people behind them. It is a dream all wrapped up in the bubbly mousse that makes Champagne the drink that has captured us all for centuries. This final week of October was a fantastic affair. While you can attend every event at La Fête, the Gala Dinner is the jewel in the crown of this wine-filled fantasy land. And this year, 2023’s La Fête, was the best yet.

There is an energy to La Fête that is grand, convivial, and over the top. A kin to the full expressions of wonder that have made artworks like Hokusai’s The Great Wave Off Kanagawa or Monet’s Water Lilies. The focus and intent of the artist behind each was all done to communicate a wonderful obsession. In this case, the obsession is Champagne. Kicked off by an afternoon at the Grand Tasting, where bubble lovers get the chance to get personal with thirty-three different Champagne houses, the Gala is a whole other animal. 
.
.
🌟 Featuring
La Fête du Champagne @lafetenyc
Daniel Johnnes @danieljohnnes
Peter Liem @peterliem
Pressoir @pressoir.wine
MMGY Wagstaff @wagstaffmktg
Photo credit: Mikhail Lipyanskiy @lipyanskiy_photo

#monarchwine #lafeteduchampagne #nyc #newyork #champagne #winetasting #winedinner #somm

This is a bold and full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon, rich and velvety with dark cherry, blueberry, chocolate, subtle spices, minty and smoky vanilla flavours smooth and plush on the palate

🍇🙌Happy #CarmenereDay wine lovers!🙌🍇
.
🥳That’s right, today is all about Carménère, and I am celebrating with all of Chile and specifically with the @conchaytoro Winemaker’s Lot 148 Carménère!
.
🤓From Bordeaux to Chile, Carménère is a grape with French roots that was once popular in the styles of old Bordeaux. However, the grape made its way around the world to Chile, where it has been able to properly take on a life of its own, not playing second fiddle with Cabernet or Merlot. Chile is a fabulous home of the grape, and while it was once thought to be Merlot, the country has embraced Carménère so much it has nearly become synonymous with the grape of Chilean winemaking
.
🇪🇺It was in the 1850s that Carménère first made it into the lexicon of Chilean winemaking, and just about thirty years later, the wine-making stylings of Concha y Toro came into view. The winery was started in 1883 with Melchor Concha y Toro and a dream to craft outstanding wines. Carménère was one of the first grapes he planted
.
🍷In the glass today with the Winemaker’s Lot 148 Carménère, this is a wine from the Rapel Valley but more specifically from the Peumo DO in Cachapoal Valley. And it is a fabulous region for Carménère!
Darkly coloured, this wine is filled with notes of mint, cinnamon sticks, red cherry, raspberry, plum and blueberry. Followed on the palate by lifted and expressive tones with green herbal notes, it is not overly tannic. It is a perfect wine for a Chilean BBQ or something roasted and delicious to pair
.
👉Find this bottle at the @LCBO -  it is made for today’s celebrations!
.
💁🏻‍♀️Will you be sipping on some yummy Carménère today?
.
[Sponsored Partnership with Wines of Chile Canada]

🥰Passito and Biscotti are a match made in heaven!
.
🎁All wrapped up and ready for a bow this holiday season. This is the perfect gift pack from @magnottawinery to experience this magical pairing. 
.
😉I have an affinity for the combination of a biscotti dipped into a sweet passito wine. This is such an Italian classic with many different renditions. But for me, I have these strong and nostalgic memories of enjoying this combination with my Nonno, my grandfather. The two together are just a match made in heaven!
.
🍷The Magnotta Vidal Passito is a fragrant wine with notes of melon, peach, white flowers, dried green fig, and touches of apricots. On the palate, it is sweet but complemented by a bright acidity, which gives this wine a great structure. 
🥰It is a very lux experience with every sip
.
🤓This wine connects Ontario winemaking with the Italian roots of Magnotta’s owners. Using Vidal grapes done air-dried and only from hand-selected vineyard offerings
.
🤩Enjoyed with the gift pack cranberry and white chocolate biscotti, creates an experience that leans into the sweetness of the wine without being overpowering. It is a perfect match!
.
🎁Get ready for all the gifting coming up for this holiday season. 
👉Find the Canadian Passito Vidal VQA Gift Set directly from Magnotta. And currently on sale too, it is the perfect time to stock up
.
💁🏻‍♀️Are you in for this heavenly combination?
.

🍷@sideral.wines - Red Wine Made For The Season Of Giving 
✨📖NEW Article in @holrmagazine
.
🤩Let’s think about it. What makes a bottle of wine a great gift? Is it the way it tastes, if it is likeable, if it communicates a story, or if it comes in a beautiful package? In many ways, all these requirements would make a wine a great gift; however, you can rarely get them all in one fell swipe. 
😉Well, that is until now
.
🍷Coming from the Cachapoal Andes region of Chile, the Sideral Red Blend from Viña San Pedro is a flawless synergy in a constellation of exceptional taste. All bottled up and now on LCBO shelves just in time for the holidays!
.
🤩Follow my #LinkInBio to read on 
🍷It is a strong flex to say a wine is worthy of a bow on top, but the Sideral is a wine that truly deserves it. Since the early 2000s, this wine has received over 91-point scores from Decanter, James Suckling and Tim Atkin. Even if you are not one for points dictating how you buy wine, it is essential to note that this wine was scored against its peers, other wines in the region. Those high marks of praise say this is a wine emblematic of Chile in the glass, all done with phenomenal winemaking.
.

.

Going on eight years and consistently working for myself along the way, I have gotten the chance to build out some great lists in Toronto, import some fantastic wine, be a part of wine judging, travel to some of the best vineyards and share my passion about what I love most - WINE!

🥂🎁#HappyHolidays 🎁🥂- 🍷Why not Celebrate The Holidays With A Wine Family!

📖If you are a receiver of the @globeandmail you might have noticed an article by yours truly in the Canada Magazine. And this latest article is all about the wine of the Wagner family
.
🤩At the heart of the holiday season is family. Both chosen and related are by your side to cheers over a delicious meal, gift-giving and to enjoy every moment together. One wine family that has stuck together in the pursuit of making great wine is the Wagner Family. The Wagners have been a part of California winemaking since the 1880s. They have helped shape the winemaking landscape of Napa and the Suisun Valley. Run today by Chuck Wagner, the man who co-founded Caymus with his parents 50 years ago, and his children Jenny and Charlie, the story of their family journey in wine is captured within every bottle they produce
.

.

🍷I’m going for a different side of Pinot Grigio today. 🇦🇷Heading south to Argentina with @graffignawine
.
🤓Graffigna is one of the wineries that tells the story of Argentinian wine history within their bottles. This winery is a part of the very fabric of winemaking in the country. It is a sense you genuinely get to imbibe with when you enjoy one of Graffigna’s wines
.
🍷Showing character in the glass, the Pinot Grigio is crafted from the many vineyards in San Juan and Mendoza. All from elevated plots on the slopes just off the Andes Mountains, these grapes take in lots of sun as they grow
.
😉Making a bolder wine than you might expect for a Pinot Grigio.
👂Listen in for all the tasting notes.
🤩But more than showing personality and great flavour in the glass, an excellent wine to pair with every holiday occasion is one with a story behind it. After leaving Italy at 12, Santiago Graffigna came to Argentina to work at his Uncle Juan Graffigna’s winery. The experience was life-changing for him, and he grew to go on and start his own winemaking endeavours in 1870, setting up Graffigna all those decades ago. Over a century later, the winery is the third oldest in Argentina and still operating
.
🎁A wine like this is perfectly timed for the holiday season, but it is the story behind it that makes this bottle conversation and gift-worthy!
.
👉Explore a different side of Pinot Grigio, find the Graffigna Pinot Grigio at the @LCBO 
.

🤩I am always a fan of a good bottle of red that can pair and match with so much. This is the time of year when you are planning for many tastes, whether it is a curated menu or potluck, the wine you choose needs to be up to the challenge of making your holiday celebrations a memorable one!
.
🍇The jewel in the crown of Argentina winemaking, the Malbec by Graffigna, is crafted from many vineyards in San Juan and Mendoza. Malbec is uniquely attuned to the winemaking regions of Argentina. As the vineyards climb up the slope of the Andes, the Malbec grapes growing within them gain more texture, aromas and structure notes with greater sun exposure
.
🙌This wine blends vineyards and plots to showcase Malbec’s glory, Graffigna style
👂Listen in for all the tasting notes and flavour details.
.
🍷While this wine is filled with character, it is a bottle that can span many different dishes. From light options like seasonal roasted veg to a touch heavier with hearty fish and chicken dishes, all the way up to a bolder meal with red meats.  This is the reason why I have gravitated to this wine this time of year
.

🍹Make the holiday celebrations memorable with a signature cocktail! Serving it up with @harveyssherry
.
🤩Always a fan of a signature party drink. It is the cocktail that will kick off the day-to-evening romp of storytelling, enjoyment and good times.
.
🥂Perfect for a cocktail that fits the vibe is Harveys Bristol Cream Sherry. 
A fabulous Sherry all on its own. Served chilled or over 🍷ice this caramel-coloured Sherry is filled with notes of dried flowers, herbs, caramel, fig and dried citrus. All notes that ring true to the holiday season!
.
🥰Running with its expression in the glass the Harveys Bristol Cream Sherry shines as the star of the show in the Frosted Apple Ginger Cocktail.
.
✨The recipe:
1oz of Harveys Bristol Cream Sherry 
1oz Apple Juice 
4oz Ginger Ale 
Build in a tall glass and serve over ice, with a cinnamon stick, mint and apple slices to garnish. 
.

.
🍹And a signature rum cocktail, a Rum Negroni Sbagliato with @diplomaticorum.official Diplomatico Reserva Exclusiva Rum.

.
🥰I love a festive pie this time of year, but I don’t have much of a sweet tooth. This is a pie that has it all! 
.
🙌Featuring so many ingredients from our neighbours to the South:

✨Fresh Cranberries, via the @uscranberries
✨Pecans, via the @americanpecan
✨Medjool Dates, via the @ndmedjooldates

😉Each organization works to bring the very best of their agriculture forward.
.

👏After all, making a delicious pie is all about the right ingredients.
.

🎄Happy Holidays, everyone! I need a caffeinated cocktail this time of year, don’t you?
.
🍸With the holidays in full swing I am cooking for many, shopping for all, and trying my level best to make it everywhere I need to be. But sometimes, I am in for taking a moment to be in all the fun and splendour of the holidays with a good cocktail!
.
🍹This is the @skrewballwhiskey Espresso Nutini
Made with Skrewball Peanut Butter Whiskey, this whiskey is a unique combination that sticks with you, it is filled with nutty sweet notes. Honestly it is so nostalgic and really yummy
.
✨All you need to craft this cocktail at home is:
2.5oz of Skrewball Peanut Butter Whiskey
0.5oz Coffee Liqueur
1.5oz Freshly Brewed Espresso
🤓Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Then, serve in a martini or coupe glass with espresso beans to garnish
.
🙌Putting the Skrewball Peanut Butter Whiskey front and center, this shaken coffee cocktail is a take on a classic that has been hot-to-trot this year!
This unique take on a classic brings in nutty and sweet caramelized notes. The Skrewball Peanut Butter Whiskey is a harmonious blend of an unlikely duo that just works. With its memorable and one-of-a-kind flavour
.
😉Find the Skrewball Peanut Butter Whiskey at the @LCBO
.
